intro: Pegolettia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf pegolettia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories. Pegolettia tenuifolia is often found in association with other epiphytic plants and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils.
